titleStmt.title: Robert Enders and Henry Enders, Affidavit
CWG9037

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: Thomas Hines being in Custody charged with the offense of Felony and being admitted to Bail in the Sum of Two Hundred and fifty dollars, Now we Robert Enders & Henry Enders of McCracken County Kentucky hereby undertake that the above named Thomas Hynes will appear in the McCracken Circuit Court at its next term to answer Said charge, and will at all times render himself amenable to the orders and process of said court in the prosecution of Said charge and if convicted will render himself in execution thereof, or if he shall fail to perform either of these conditions, that we will pay to the Commonwealth of Kentucky the Sum of Two Hundred and fifty dollars.

Witness our hands this July 21st 1863
R. Enders
H. Enders

Attest
J. R. Fuller.
A copy
Att. B Small C M C C

McCracken Circuit Court Sct.
October Term 1863
The Commonwealth of Ky
against } Receiving stolen Goods.
Thomas Hynes & Jas Upjohn defts

The defendants were Solemnly called, but came not. It is therefore adjudged that their bonds be taken as forefeited, and that a summons issue against said Hines & H & R. Enders their securities returnable to the next term & against Said Upjohn and J. E. Woodward & B. P. Woodward Securities.

A copy
Att. B Small C M C C

McCracken Cir Ct
vs
Remit except fees & costs
Thos Hines, R & Henry Enders
Forfeiture
$250 --
Oct term 1863
